meanings.definition: To formulate or express in a new or different way.
meanings.sent1: She reformulated her essay to make it clearer to the readers.
meanings.sent2: The chef reformulated the recipe to include healthier ingredients.
meanings.sent3: John reformulated his excuse for being late, but no one believed him.
meanings.sent4: The artist reformulated her style after visiting a new gallery.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reformulated the hypothesis to account for the unexpected results.

meanings.definition: To change the form or structure of something.
meanings.sent1: The company reformulated its product packaging to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: After feedback, the architect reformulated the building design to be more sustainable.
meanings.sent3: The magician reformulated his trick to surprise the audience even more.
meanings.sent4: The storm reformulated the landscape, leaving behind a new river.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reformulated the lesson plan to better engage the students.
